name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoate has a melting point of 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group (–CH3) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increasing the molecular weight and volume. The phenyl group (–C1=CC=CC=C1) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The carbamate group (–CO–) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increasing the molecular weight and forming hydrogen bonds.
